title: How to Delete the Cache on Your Xbox 360

methods.name: Clear system cache under Device Options

steps.headline: Scroll across to the system tab and select the storage devices option.
Highlight the hard drive or memory unit option (it should say "Hard Drive, 12 GB free", for example).
Select "Clear System Cache".
steps.description: The following message should appear: "This will perform maintenance on your Xbox 360 storage device. Do you want to continue?"

steps.headline: Restart your console.
steps.description: You have now cleared your hard drive cache and your Xbox 360 should run faster and have improved game-play on certain games (The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim, Fallout 3, Halo 3, or other games).

steps.headline: When it is starting up, hold down button A.
This will clear all patches.
steps.description: The Xbox should run faster and have improved gameplay.

text: Clear system cache under Device Options Turn on your Xbox 360.  Scroll across to the system tab and select the storage devices option.  Highlight the hard drive or memory unit option (it should say "Hard Drive, 12 GB free", for example).  Press Y for "Device options".  Select "Clear System Cache". The following message should appear: "This will perform maintenance on your Xbox 360 storage device. Do you want to continue?" Select "Yes".  Restart your console. You have now cleared your hard drive cache and your Xbox 360 should run faster and have improved game-play on certain games (The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim, Fallout 3, Halo 3, or other games). Hold A on Startup Start your Xbox 360.  When it is starting up, hold down button A.  This will clear all patches. The Xbox should run faster and have improved gameplay.
sentences: Clear system cache under Device Options Turn on your Xbox 360.
Scroll across to the system tab and select the storage devices option.
Highlight the hard drive or memory unit option (it should say "Hard Drive, 12 GB free", for example).
The following message should appear: "This will perform maintenance on your Xbox 360 storage device.
You have now cleared your hard drive cache and your Xbox 360 should run faster and have improved game-play on certain games (The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim, Fallout 3, Halo 3, or other games).
Hold A on Startup Start your Xbox 360.
When it is starting up, hold down button A.
The Xbox should run faster and have improved gameplay.
